author: Staff Reporter
text:
It’s raining crafts and textiles at the Poompuhar exhibition at Sri Vijayalakshmi Thirumana Mandapam ihere.

The Tamil Nadu Handicrafts Development Corporation, Salem, is organising the annual exhibition to the delight of art and craft lovers. On display are brass lamps, Thanjavur art plates, terra cotta and rose wood products, rose wood inlay work panels, sandal wood and sandal wood products, bronze and brass ware, black metal and white metal products, jute products, paintings, wood carvings, and Kondapalli dolls, among others. And for those who seek variety in textiles, there is gagra cholis, Rajasthan dress materials, Lucknow chikan works; kalamkarai works, vazhnal silk sarees, Madurai Chungadi sarees, printed cotton sarees, designer sarees, synthethic silk sarees, bedspreads, shawls, and stoles.

There is an array of hand bags, cushion covers, and wall hangings, besides jewellery.

A discount of up to 20 per cent is offered on various products. The exhibition is open till March 6 between 10 a.m. and 8 p.m.
title: Poompuhar exhibition begins
